content.question: A particle moves along the curve <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator 15, and denominator x squared, plus 1.3 to the x power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>1.3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math> for <math alttext="x greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate of the particle changes at a constant rate of <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units per second. At the instant when the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate of the particle is <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the rate of change of the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate of the particle, in units per second?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
